activities.loc: Waushara Co. Courthouse 2nd Floor Room 230, Branch 1

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frank J. Deringer

records.addlTxt: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars except in furtherance of employment as a musician, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is prohibited from being in possession of any firearms. No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license for the manner of operation.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Case called @ 1:41 PM Defendant Frank J. Deringer in court.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for Frank J. Deringer. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The Court places the case in suspended status pending toxicology results.  Motion by Atty Blankschein for modification of the bond condition regarding the defendant's presence on the premises of bars or taverns for employment purposes. Statement by ADA Kottke regarding the motion. The Court modifies the conditions of bond as requested.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on November 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Frank J. Deringer
Current: W4748 State Road 21, Redgranite, WI 54970   (Effective: 03-03-2022)
Prior: W4748 State Road 21; Lohrville, Redgranite, WI 54970

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is prohibited from being in possession of any firearms. No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license for the manner of operation.

Case called @ 1:20 PM Defendant Frank J. Deringer appeared, in custody, appears by video with Attorney Emma K Blankschein. Attorney Matthew Lesuink appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. Bond argument by DA Leusink. Bond argument by Atty Blankschein. Court orders $500 Cash Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Initial appearance scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Initial appearance on March 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
